author: Howard Graff
comment: The Dutch and Belgian radar data is completely blank. I'm in the eastern UK, and so I get very poor use of this app when the weather is coming from the east, with no Dutch /Belgian data!

author: Gerard Tyrer
comment: Umbrella widget is not showing as an option

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: When you add the widget, make sure to select Rain Alarm 1x1 (NOT 2x1) and then the classic design afterwards.

author: Timo Hosen
comment: Thanks for Family Support! 1A App!

author: Peter Jameson
comment: A superb app with pure genius design. Rain Alarm Pro gives me notification when rain is on the way and I can choose any sound on my 'phone or tablet if I want an audible alarm. Since it runs a visual sequence of the rain progression on my screen, I can estimate the time of the rain's arrival and not only that, I can see very easily if the clouds are growing in size or evaporating. Brilliant, just brilliant. Astonishing support from the developer too!

This app has been working fine after some problems with it a while back but today it hasn't updated the radar image for more than four hours despite the timeline at the bottom of the screen doing so. This is happening with my home wifi, on 4G and on the WiFi at work. Uninstalling and reinstalling it hasn't made any difference. This app remains stubbornly at a three star rating, I'm afraid.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: It is working again! The issue appeared again yesterday and was finally sorted by the Met Office in the afternoon at about 2 PM.

author: Jerry K
comment: I owe so much to this app for staying dry. Well worth the cost! Of all the apps I have, this is the one that has stayed on my device for a long time. P. S. I have not had any notice of battery consumption using this app.

author: Jon Day
comment: Brilliant little app, a must have for cyclists. I never leave home without first checking this app. It's saved me a soaking on many occasions. You often see windows of opportunity to avoid heavy showers, very handy. I don't often purchase apps but this is worth paying for the Pro non-advert version.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: It is working again! The issue appeared again yesterday and was finally sorted by the Met Office in the afternoon at about 2 PM.

author: michael scott
comment: Been using this app for a while now, never had any issues with it, it's accurate, always know whether or not to take my umbrella out with me or not, but recently it's not been showing any precipitation, my map is covered in a shaded area,as if the map hasn't updated or loaded

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: There was an issue with the data we get from the UK Met Office. They finally fixed the issue just now and it should have started working again for you.

comment: My go to rain radar for the Sunshine Coast Qld, and Australia. A must have!!

author: Robert Skyrme
comment: Love this works a charm, however UK data missing right now?

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: It is working again! The issue appeared again yesterday and was finally sorted by the Met Office in the afternoon at about 2 PM.

author: P1aul Bankes
comment: NO UK updates for a few days now. ?

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: It is working again! The issue appeared again yesterday and was finally sorted by the Met Office in the afternoon at about 2 PM.

author: Eck Thump
comment: Works fine on this Note 4.

author: David Saw
comment: Great weather apps!!!

author: mark honda
comment: Excellent

author: Troy & Jodie T
comment: I love the app..... When it works... Keeps crashing on the Note 4. Last two months I get a few crashes a day. No response from app developer. Getting annoying.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content:
The problem you describe is nothing we are aware of, yet, so we need more information to investigate. Does the app crash right away or after a while? If it is after a while, go to the help section, diagnose & contact, and send us the diagnostic data from there by mail. 
Update: We haven't heard back from you, can you give us an update?

author: Ben Geronimo
comment: No maps displayed. Just dot of colors. Help!

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content:
Can you send us a screenshot? android@rain-alarm.com
Please also try the following: go to the device settings, apps, "Google Play Services", and delete data and updates for it (we get our map through this app). Restart your device and normally this should fix it. Please let us know if it works.

author: Martinbp00
comment: Very great application, accurate and complete. I would like if had more than 13 number of images

author: Morgan Vaughn
comment: Would be nice if this app was able to tell the difference between rain and snow. Years and it still doesn't.

author: Timothy Bishop
comment: Love this app.
title: TCB 46140

author: Kaal Alexander Rosser
comment: Used to be a good app, which is why I paid for the pro version. But recently just about every useful customisation has been removed. Now you can basically turn off all the alarms or get alerted about everything in a 15 mile radius or more. Pointless.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: Which customisations are you missing? There were only 1-2 minor things that were removed, but some things might have simply moved. Just talk to us and we should be able to help: android@rain-alarm.com

author: Wilfred Dennis
comment: I love it! Made my work with ease. Just want to suggest that to add an option for adding labels on widgets. Sometimes I use multiple widgets and I get confuse on with widgets it is. Thanks for the great development of this app.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: You can only define the radius as a number now, not visually anymore. Main reason was to clean and simplify the settings. I'll add it to the list of things we reevaluate again.

author: gary gibson
comment: Good. Just wish it showed wind direction so I could predict if the rain would reach or bypass my location. A non-circular seek area orientated to the wind direction would also improve this app

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: You can find the search sector setting under settings, alarm, more, search sector.

author: Simon Barker
comment: I have been using this for a couple of years now and I have got friends using it. I have come to rely on this for its accuracy and it's helped me out loads. What ever weather apps I have on my phone this one stays. Simple and does what it says .

author: Barry Wilson
comment: Brilliant, I trust this app more than the weather channel !!

author: Stuart Evans
comment: This app is fantastic but i have friends on Facebook after posting some screen shots on my wall asking if the developer has done a version for Apple devices on the Apple store.  I have googled rain alarm for Apple and have found out that the rain alarm app by Michael Diener software e.K is currently not available on Apple devices.  So are Michael Diener software e.K going to do a version for Apple device users.  Only i have friends who want to buy or try your app on their Apple devices let us know if you decide to do an Apple version of your rain alarm app.  Although i have joked that they could always trade in their Apple device for an Android device.😀

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: Rain Alarm for iOS is made by my partner company "Carlos Aviles Software". They use the very same data and alarms. In the future the design will also be similar and it will get as many features as the Android version. You can find it here: https://itunes.apple.com/app/rainalarm/id397676100

author: Andy Tate
comment: Many thanks for the latest little update which restored the ability to set close ( 20km or less) alarms as we could in v4. The point about wanting to be able to set the alarm radius less then 15km is because I live to the north of a ridge of hills and the prevailing SW winds often mean the rain stays on the southern side of the hills and does not effect us. THANKS for listening and acting on your feedback reviews. SO good to have such a responsive developer!  (Earlier) Wonderful - just what I need on my phone, an alarm for rain.  The beauty of rain alarm has always been the immediate and local nature of the information - something normal weather forecast apps are not so good at.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: Did you test the alarms of the new version, yet? It should give you less redundant alarms. If you still get too many for your specific use case, I suggest you either decrease sensitivity in the alarm settings or apply the search sector (settings, alarm for main location, more).

author: Helga S.
comment: I've been using this app for around 5 years now. It has never once let me down, ever. It's one of the first apps I download when I have a new device or need to do a factory reset. When opening my tablet it's on my homepage where I can always give it a quick glance especially when rain has been forecast and I've got washing on the line. The settings are very customisable and the alarm is a great help. Also the developer is always quick to answer any email requesting help. I'd give this gem 100 stars if I could.

author: Ta2r0b
comment: It works so I love it
Have updated to new upgrade but audible alerts have stopped - sound and voice. It has now become a 'check and see' app.  Is there a way to correct this on a Samsung Galaxy S6?

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: Please open the top right menu in the app, go to help, diagnsoe & contact, and send us the diagnostic data by mail. Add a small message reminding us about the issue again. It's probably a small settings issue and this will help us find it.

author: Chris M
comment: The developer replied very quickly and fixed my issue thank you! I couldn't find the advanced settings until now. Excellent app and dev.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content:
You can still set these for each of the defined alarms. Go to settings, alarms, pick one of the alarms, advanced - there you'll find the search radius and area setting.
If you'd like to see percentage instead of x/10, simply go to the app's display settings and change the notification style.

author: J d'Sifus
comment: This is not a forecaster but an alarm that actually works. Get the paid app because it's worth it! This app hasn't failed me yet. ... It really works!👍😆

author: Peter Michael Petioky
comment: the rain radar data might be accurate but do not fit to the map or time or both. there is heavy rain while the app shows nothing at all. the app shows rain where / when it's gone for half an hour..

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: That does not sound right, for which city in which country is this? In general we always show the latest weather radar data available. Depending on the country, this can be 5-10 minutes old. This delay comes from the weather service first gathering and processing the data. Other apps have that delay, too, but they might not make it so obvious.

author: Jim McParland
comment: Was better, now the alert area is too big and I keep getting alerts for storms that never come close

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: Did you reduce the search radius already? You can do this in the settings under alarms, pick on alarm, advanced. The minimum is 15 km / 10 mi. If the minimum is not enough, let us know what would work for you.

author: Nick Price
comment: Great app, especially good in the UK. Wish it could cover France and more of the Mediterranean.

author: Cecil Paradiso
comment: Reply 8/3/17: still haven't had any precip so impossible to test against actual rain and radar hasn't shown any false echoes the last few days so alarm hasn't gone off. My point is that the same radar images are being accessed by this new version as the previous version but now I'm getting inaccurate alarms or no alarms when there has been precip in the area. The search radius seems way too big even though I've set it to the minimum. This creates alarms for precip that don't even come close to my location. The sensitivity also seems off since v5 as occasionally no alarm will sound and precip had already begun. Like I said, I have been using this app for years so I'm pretty familiar with it's operation and this new version just doesn't work as good as the previous version for me. (end reply).  Since update to v5, I more than occasionally get alarms when there is no rain and none or inaccurate alerts when there is. Yes, the radar image will show a false echo for 1 frame - no precip here in the Seattle area for over a month - but this darn thing goes crazy for it. I've tried the default settings, my own trusted settings I have used for years (at least the ones I can correlate to the new settings) and wacky settings just to test with no appreciable differences. I basically just use it for the radar now as the intended functionality has been severely compromised and is no longer useful to me. Was my most used app by far. I wish I didn't upgrade.

reply.author: Michael Diener - Software e.K.
reply.content: So the false echoes were causing the alarm to go off when there was no rain - 1 problem solved. Regarding the alarm in general, there are no known issues (as there are no other recent reports and our tests work fine) and this is why we need more information to investigate. Please get in touch by email (space here is limited): android@rain-alarm.com

author: Brian Remick
comment: This app works great! Helps me out a ton when out on the motorcycle. Definitely recommended.

author: Duncan Mitchell
comment: Wonderful new app, thank you

author: Pk Muzz
comment: Very Usefull *****

author: Namron Setay
comment: I'm a biker and got this app for the alerts, but it's turned into my daily go-to weather app. Active dev.

author: Brian Fistler
comment: This is one of my favorite weather apps.  Smoother and faster loading radar than any other app I've come across.  Highly useful.
